utterance.speaker: FATHER MCMURTRY
utterance.content: Hello? Is anybody here? Hello. I came like you asked. Hello?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: In celebration of our finally getting together, I have made a very special dessert.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, that looks incredible.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s to die for. Literally. I call it death by chocolate.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Now given your baking experience, is that a prediction?

utterance.speaker: JIM BECKETT
utterance.content: I take it cooking’s not one of your talents, Martha.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well … not really. I sort of save my creative energy to perfect a more worthy craft. Acting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about you, Jim? How’s the law treating you?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Ah, good. I’ve got a class action lawsuit that’s keeping me pretty busy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, well I hope you find time to cut loose, Jim, and just do something fun.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Well, of course. I try to take in a baseball game every now and again.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh lord. Baseball? Isn’t that dreadfully dull?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Well, it requires a certain … patience.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: A certain lack of pulse, you mean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think, uh, what my dad responds to is the game’s nuance.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh well, yes, of course it has its merits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I think my mother just means it’s not exactly, uh … action packed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, but that would depend on how you look at it, right?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Yeah, I suppose it does appeal to the more serious, more discerning crowd.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Jim. What exactly does that mean?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Just that actors by their nature aren’t the most serious people, right?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, is that so? So you think I’m not a serious person?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about if we dive in to this dessert?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Cause honestly that whole death thing is sounding pretty good right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s been a murder down town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Close enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so sorry that we have to run.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You two be careful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you guys, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, there have been worse dinners.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the dining scene from Alien comes to mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Honestly, a creature bursting out of my dad’s chest might have lightened the mood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess we should have expected it. They come from such different worlds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, your mom should have been more sensitive to that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks. Ooh. You look nice. Lipstick, huh? Date night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Dinner with her dad and my mom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow, already? How’d that go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, well, speaking of fathers, we have one right over here. Father Joel McMurtry, 52. Real estate lady showed up to show the property –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And found religion instead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, do we know what our victim was doing in an abandoned building?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet. And he’s a long way from home. His parish is uptown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Between 7 and 10 last night. Likely cause of death three to the chest.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s a tight grouping. The killer’s a marksman.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Careful, too. He picked up all the spent shell casings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Security cams?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: None of them are pointing at this building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well this looks like the work of a pro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone had a priest assassinated? It’s like a Vatican conspiracy. Ah, it’s like the DaVinci Code.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or … not. So why don’t we look into McMurtry’s life and see if anyone had motive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A nun is meeting us downtown. She worked closely with him, so she may be able to shed some light.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks. We got it. So uh – Unis on the canvass got a hit on Chumson’s Tavern. Bartender there, a Jerry Jenkins, says he knows about the murder but would only speak to a detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle and I will talk with him, you guys chat with the nun.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, oh … wait a second. We’re interviewing a nun?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And I’m going to be the good cop. You’re going to be the bad cop, so …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh…

utterance.speaker: JERRY JENKINS
utterance.content: I asked for a detective, seeing as how my customers seem to get scared away by uniformed cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerry, what do you know about the murder?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Last night this guy wanders in. Leo. Says he heard shots on the corner of 5th. That he seen some guy hustling out of the building there. Then today I hear some priest got popped.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So this Leo was a witness. And idea where Leo is now?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: He got pretty lit, so I loaded him in a cab and sent him home. Up in the Bronx.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember the address?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Sure. 9245 223rd Street.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A nun walks into a precinct. It’s like the beginnings of a bad joke.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Want to borrow a comb or something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what this reminds me of? Watching one of those body switching movies where the guy looks like a grown man but he’s actually 12.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Let me tell you something. Catholic school is like combat. Unless you’ve been there you don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, I have been there. In combat. And it’s way worse than some old lady.

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: This is a dark day. Father McMurtry was a such a caring man. So devoted to his parishioners, his community. That she should meet such a fate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sister Mary, we have a few questions for you about Father McMurtry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That is, if you’re up for it, Sister Mary.

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: I can tell you anything you need to know about the Father. Including who murdered him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know who killed him?

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: Isn’t that what I just said? I was afraid their friendship would end badly. But the Father was so trusting. Always trying to save lost souls, even souls as black as that man’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What man’s, Sister Mary?

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: Michael Dolan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is Mickey Dolan? The mobster? The enforcer for the O’Reilly family?

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: The very same. He and Dolan grew up together. I – I tried to warn him, but he always believed that he could set Mr. Dolan on a better path. He died believing it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If they were friends, why do you think that Dolan killed him?

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: They had a terrible fight outside the church two days ago. I don’t know what it was about, but the Father was very upset afterwards. Very upset.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well a fight alone doesn’t prove –

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: I wasn’t finished.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh course, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: SISTER MARY
utterance.content: As I was about to say, last night at 6 the Father got a call and left in the middle of Mass. He told me the call was about Dolan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The priest and the mobster. It’s a classic story. Friends since childhood, one takes a higher calling while the other follows a path to crime and murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If this witness can ID Dolan then his path is going to lead straight to state prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I still think we should have taken the subway. It’s kind of dangerous to park up here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah – what did you mean earlier when you said my mother could be more considerate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just – I meant that I wished that you would have asked her to stop criticizing my dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was just expressing an opinion. In much the same way you father was when he basically called my mom flighty and stupid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My dad never said that, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? Just drop it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you know, to be fair - – she was just commenting about his past time while he was insulting her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, watch it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well there’s a big difference –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys are making a big mistake. I’m a cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The boss, as in, Mickey Dolan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know about McMurtry. Just walk away while you’ve got a chance.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Hey, what’s all the noise out here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry! Sorry! Sorry.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These locks won’t hold. Castle, bring that over. We gotta block the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A little help?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They must have cut the line.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What’s this? What the hell going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re here to save you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somehow I don’t believe you.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What guy? Am I the guy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You’re the guy.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What do they want with me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That guy you say holding a gun? He killed somebody. And you’re the witness.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A witness they want to get rid of.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Okay, this is not good. Not good. How do they even know what I saw?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same way we do. You ran your mouth off at a bar.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: It – it was dark. I – I didn’t even really see that much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As far as they’re concerned, you saw enough.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Oh, come on. We got to get out of here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon. It’s not going to take Dolan’s boys long to get through that door.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Dolan? As in Mickey Dolan, the mobster? Oh, God. We’re going to end up floating in the river with cement shoes on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, technically if you have cement shoes on you’re not going to be floating.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. That’s not helping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dude, where’s your car?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s my car?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Where’s your car?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was right here!

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: You parked here? Are you kidding me? Don’t you see this neighborhood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go! Go, go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So the nun was right. Father McMurtry did fight with Mickey Dolan. Surveillance cam footage outside the church backs Sister Mary’s story. Not that I’d ever doubt a nun.

utterance.speaker: VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: What about the phone call McMurtry got? You trace it to Dolan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah, it was made from a payphone. Guy spent 20 years rising through the ranks of the Irish mob. It’s not surprising he would cover his tracks.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Dolan and his kill squad are as smart as they are ruthless. And as the enforcer for the O’Reilly family he’s the prime suspect for dozens of hits, only we’ve never been able to make a case against him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Unis came back from Dolan’s apartment. Looks like he hasn’t been there in a while.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Does the Organized Crime taskforce know where he is?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They say that he’s been off their radar the past few days. Word is, there’s something big going on. Maybe a turf war or a power struggle within the O’Reilly family. There may be bloodshed, so they figure Dolan went underground.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The guy took out a priest. We can’t just let him disappear.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, no. Even if we knew where he was, we don’t have enough to charge him. Shoot Beckett Dolan’s mug shot, See if their witness can ID him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. On it.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Is that them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well our night has officially been trashed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hurry, Castle. The payphone before they get back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe they still have these things. All right, does anybody have a – a dollar? Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t need coins to call 911.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta keep moving.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Great. That’s just great. We’re stuck in the outer borough with two mobsters trying to kill us and no means of contact to the outside world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leo, would you just relax? Okay? We just gotta find a phone. Are there any 24 hour businesses around here?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: No, not that I know of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we can borrow a cell from someone.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yeah, from who? Around here no one’s out this time of night unless they have a death wish.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leo –

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Oh my God, this is – this is insane. This kind of stuff doesn’t happen to me. I’m a paper salesman. I sell paper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leo! Can you focus?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re going to be okay. We’re all going to be okay. We just need to contact my precinct.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yeah. How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Captain. We’ve got a problem.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, what’s your problem?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We tried to send Dolan’s mug shot, but we can’t reach Beckett or Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We called their phones, Beckett’s radio, we even called Castle’s mom.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did you ping her cruiser?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. GPS shows it’s heading down the Jersey turnpike.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ryan, have troopers intercept that car. Oh, and Esposito? Go to that witnesses address and find out what the hell’s going on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it’s not working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It will. I’m disturbing the peace. They’ll have no choice but to –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - offer me a beer.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Next time, I won’t miss.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: You have any idea what time it is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes! Please, we need your help!

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re going to need some help, all right, if you don’t stop buzzing. So knock it off before I do something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah? What are you going to do? Call a cop? Matter of fact, go ahead. I’m not going to stop buzzing ‘til you do.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Cops? Cops don’t come up here, jack. This hood? We’re on our own. You keep that up I’m gonna come down there and hurt you real bad.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: So that’s your big plan? Make more people want to kill us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Yeah, keep on walking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe a fight will bring the cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Or maybe the guys that are chasing us?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Assuming we survive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I’m trying to get us out of this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you are the reason we are in this in the first place!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The next time two thugs are about to jump us and I say “watch it” why don’t you just listen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe if you had listened to me about the car.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Okay well, I’m picking up some tension here and I’m sensing it has less to do with the two maniacs chasing us and more with the two of you. And seeing as my life is in your hands, maybe –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? We’re fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Some of us more than others. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s a cell phone in the car.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it’s password protected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice work. The alarm brought those guys back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ryan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro. We got a problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I don’t think they saw us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re not going to stop looking.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Maybe I should talk to them. Well, so I should what? So I should just stay here and wait for them to find us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well maybe that’s not the only option. If I can figure out the passcode for this phone, we can use it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re the boy with the dragon tattoo now? There’s like ten thousand possibilities.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have a better idea?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s the nearest subway is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now she wants to take the subway.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: The C train six blocks from here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. So on weeknights after midnight it runs every half hour on the hour. What time is it now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 1:20. Okay, so we’re not going to make the 1:30 but we can make the 2:00. We just sit tight for 10 minutes then we’ll make a run for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The subway’s not Amtrak. There is no schedule.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes there is!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve lived here all my life. There is no schedule.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve lived here all my life as well. You just don’t know about it because it doesn’t always run on time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is the same thing as not having a schedule. So what happens? We go there, the train is late. Then what? We’re sitting ducks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re sitting ducks now!

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Okay, I’m starting to feel like I’d be safer outside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, look. If I can’t figure out the code, then we make a break for the subway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: I’m so gonna die.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The tenant saw two guys break down a door and push into the apartment.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Sounds like Dolan sent the guys to get the witness and Castle and Beckett got caught in the middle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about Beckett’s car? Did you find it?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Troopers stopped Beckett’s cruiser on the turnpike. Seems a couple of delinquents took it for a joyride.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Most likely Dolan’s people took them. Or worse. I’ve got unis canvassing this building. See if anybody knows anything.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, coordinate with them. And then you can get back here ASAP.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Captain Gates?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Captain Gates.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What are you two doing down here?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well after I got a call from Detective Esposito I became very concerned, so I checked in with –

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: I can’t reach Katie. What’s the situation?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: There’s no cause for alarm. It’s just that we’re having trouble pinpointing their perspective –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh please, stop. You are a terrible actress. There is no way that anyone would have called me if they weren’t really worried and I want to know what is really going on here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay. They went to interview a witness and we lost contact. But we’re doing our best to find them. So I suggest you both go home and I’ll call you the second I know more.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I am not leaving until I know what has happened to our children.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Neither am I.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right – where is that fancy coffee machine that Richard bought for the precinct? Over there?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The break room.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay. You want - ?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t want to have to tell those two that I lost their kids. Tell me you have something on Dolan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, nothing yet on Dolan. But I started looking into his associates. During the past week they’ve all split town. It all could have something to do with this turf war. But I was able to locate one of Dolan’s guys that is still in town. Colin Clark. But he’s flying to Dublin tomorrow morning.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then bring him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Do you see anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But it doesn’t mean that they’re not out there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: You got it? How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All I had to do was get inside the mind of the owner of the phone. She drives a Mini, right? Tried that, nada. Look at the back of the case. Hearts. Tried love, still no. But – – look at the lock screen.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The password’s the cat’s name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Great. So what’s the cat’s name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He doesn’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But – as soon as we figure it out, we’re golden.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we’re looking for some real solutions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I’m offering them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How? By focusing on a phone that’s never gonna –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were saying? And I don’t need the passcode to answer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello you godsend, thank God you called.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Hey, whoever you are you better bring my phone back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, this is your phone?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I need that phone. It’s got all my pictures of Lola on it, all my apps, all my music –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey. Tell her to call 911 and tell her where we are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay, listen, listen. We’re in Lexmark Park –

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I know exactly where you are. I used GPS to track you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did? You did. Good, good. Then uh – then… call 911. We are in trouble.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Well damn right you are. Especially if I get my hands on you.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Tell her about the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shhh. Shhh.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: What? Kill her? Are you threatening me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. Not kill her, killer. Killer. We’re being chased. We need you to call 91 –

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Don’t threaten me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Hello?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Why’d you let her hang up? We were so close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I let her hang up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, all is not lost. She told me the passcode. The cat’s name is Lola. Bingo! Who’s the genius now? Now, all I need to do is – No! No, no, no.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She remotely disabled the phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys! There’s a cab outside! It’s going slow enough, I think we can catch it.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Ow! My ankle, my ankle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go, go! Stop the cab, stop the cab. I got him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, man? You are killing me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: CABBIE
utterance.content: Hey. Hey, hey! Off duty!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, please! This is an emergency. I’m a police officer –

utterance.speaker: CABBIE
utterance.content: I’m the sultan of Siam. These are my loyal subjects.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. You don’t understand. This isn’t a joke. We need your help.

utterance.speaker: CABBIE
utterance.content: You got trouble written all over you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I will give you $1 thousand dollars to get us into the city.

utterance.speaker: CABBIE
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CABBIE
utterance.content: Let’s see the money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well – I don’t have it on me, but I do have this lovely watch –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It tells time underwater. It tells time in three time zones!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And right now it’s telling me it’s time to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Move! C’mon, move!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go. Go, go, go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here! C’mon!

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I hurt my ankle pretty badly. I can’t stand on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shhh. It’s not going to take those guys very long to figure out where we went.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. But if he can’t stand it’s going to be hard to move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Even harder to run.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Colin Clark. Quite the list of priors. It says here you’re a suspected foot soldier for the O’Reilly family.

utterance.speaker: COLIN CLARK
utterance.content: I also like long walks on the beach. Your guys had no right to bring me here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t have time for games, Colin. Where’s Mickey Dolan and what did he do with Detective Beckett and Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: COLIN
utterance.content: You can’t keep me here. You’ve got nothing on me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, I can hold you for 24 hours. Your plane leaves in 7. Are things about to get ugly inside the O’Reilly clan? Is that why you’re so eager to get out of dodge? Oh honey, I’m going to let you catch your flight. Hell, I’ll even drive you to the airport. But you will tell me what I need to know.

utterance.speaker: COLIN
utterance.content: You cops have no idea what’s about to go down. What Dolan’s really in to.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t care what he’s in to. I want him and I want my people.

utterance.speaker: COLIN
utterance.content: You know what I want? My lawyer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He knows. He knows where they are. A few minutes alone in there and I’ll get him to talk about it, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What Dolan’s really in to. So there’s no O’Reilly family feud. That’s basically what he just said. So why is everybody scrambling?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What does that matter?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well if we understand what Dolan was in to it might tell us where to find him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I want to see if tech can lip read that video of him and Father McMurtry. Let’s find out what he was talking about, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re still out there. It doesn’t look like they know where we are, but they’ll figure it out eventually.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, they’re not getting through here. But the door to upstairs opens from the other side.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Oh, great. So when they figure out we’re down here they’ll come through there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll be long gone by then.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: How? Okay? We’re even farther from the subway now and I hurt my ankle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll find something to tape it up.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Screw tape. Can you find another ankle in these boxes? Otherwise I’m not making it eight blocks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We might not have to. This is a menu from a 24 hour Chinese restaurant two blocks from here. If we can get there we should be able to get some help. We just gotta wait for this guy to leave. Find some tape?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes I did. I also found a box of tools and a broken CB radio. But I think I can get it to work.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Great. You have an engineering degree or electronic experience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But I’ve seen every episode of MacGyver. What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t say anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you didn’t have to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At least I’m offering real world solutions, Castle. Not TV ones.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry. What’s – what’s wrong with you two? There are people outside that want to kill us. So what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is no problem.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: No, there’s a problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We had dinner with the parents and her dad –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My dad? More like your mom.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Oh, oh, okay. So you guys, you’re not just partners. You’re … partners. I get it. Okay. I’ve done over a thousand hours of therapy, granted, as a patient. But I picked up a few things and I can tell you this much. This, uh, thing? It’s not about your folks, ‘kay? That’s just an excuse. This fight? It’s about the two of you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I doubt the NYPD would appreciate the hole I’ve been pacing in their break room floor. I thought I’d join you. Oh! I brought you that.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh it’s awful.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: It’s fine. I just normally take my coffee black.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, well –

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: You know, simple. Boring.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh no, you don’t think I think you are boring –

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: It’s fine. It’s fine. Look, that whole dinner party things just seems so absurd –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Baseball is – is

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: It’s fine.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, - it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Jim, I don’t know how you do this. You know, I thought I would get used to this … new part of Richard’s life, the constant danger and never knowing. But I really thought there would come a moment, just a moment, when the worry would stop.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Katie’s been doing this for more than a decade now and I – I’ve had this clench in my gut since the day they handed her the shield. She does say she always feels safest when your son’s watching her back.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He says the same thing about her. Well, at least wherever they are they have each other to lean on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What Leo said was crazy, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. C’mon. We’re a couple of idiots who can’t remember what we were fighting about. So … what were we fighting about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t – I just – I wanted the dinner to go well and when it didn’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said different worlds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said that they’re form different worlds. And that we should just expect it. And then I started thinking about us, You’re like this world famous bestselling author and I’m just this cop and – and we’re in this relationship that makes absolutely no sense on paper and sometimes I just start wondering. Are we kidding ourselves?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if this bubble bursts? What are we then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate. We’re not our parents. All right? And when I said two different worlds I didn’t mean –

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Heads up, I’m facing a nasty wreck on the Big 2-8.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Hello, can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe I’m not speaking the right language. Breaker, breaker. I got a mama bear and two joes who need a ride back to the bear cave. I once had Derrick Storm beat up a trucker.

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Someone’s cutting in. Ah, it’s just static.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Do you copy? Can you copy me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The mic must be broken.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey. Guy’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is going to be our best chance to make a run for the Chinese restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We go together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, with his ankle? And – and we can’t leave him alone. And one of us has a better chance of going unnoticed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m the cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why you should stay with the witness. Besides, it’s him they want dead, not me.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Thanks for the reminder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Don’t worry. I’ll bring you back a doggie bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Be inconspicuous. Just an average white guy, walking in the Bronx in the middle of the night. What could go wrong?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we think we know what Mickey and our victim were fighting about. Camera was too far away so we couldn’t read their lips.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But we found something else. Look what happens right after Mickey leaves. Check out the guys in the car.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Those are Federal agents.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like McMurtry was informing on Dolan to the Feds.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which explains why Mickey Dolan wanted him dead.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And if the Feds had eyes on Dolan they may know where he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chinese restaurant. Chinese restaurant. Something smells – - delicious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry about kicking you in the … you know. No hard feelings right? We’re all good, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re all – good, right?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY DOLAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. Kinda depends on you.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Nervous?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I’m uh … just trying to send a message. They can hear static when I press the button so I thought I’d send an SOS, but …

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: It’s okay to be worried.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s going to be fine. He’s um, he’s smart and he’s resourceful, so …

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Larger than life. From another world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you –

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Please. We’re in a basement. Sound carries. I heard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was a personal conversation.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: About how different you two are and that worries you, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t want to have this discussion right now.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: And those differences that are so charming now, they may just end up pulling you apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you? Dr. Phil?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: No. Just a guy that may die tonight realizing that life’s short. Trust me. Living your life for now makes a lot more sense than worrying about the future.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: So where’s Leo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leo who?

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: You’re funny. I like that.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: So I know the chick’s a cop, but you don’t smell like NYPD. So what’s your skin in this game?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m uh, I’m a writer. I work with the police department.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah? What do you write?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mystery novels.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Oh. I don’t have the patience for books. But when I do read, I tend to skip to the last page.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that kind of spoils the fun, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Eh, maybe. But I damn good at figuring out endings. Like in the case of our little story. I’m pretty sure it’s only going to end one way. You’re going to tell me where the hell that cop has my witness.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what you’re asking. Why would I tell you where they are? I mean, I’m already dead. Why would I let you have them, too?

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: You play poker?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I’ve cashed in my fair share of chips.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Me too. And I find that the key is in reading a man’s bluff. So let’s test your bluffing skills. When we picked you up you were on your way for help, right? That means Leo and the cop are in a building somewhere laying low. Now, is that building on the north side or the south side of the street?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: North.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: That means south. We picked you up on the corner of 225th and Lex. So they’re within a couple of blocks. Are they on 227th? 226th? 224th? Ah. 224th it is. Go get ‘em.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: They’re coming back. What should be do?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thank you for coming, Agent Lucas.

utterance.speaker: FBI AGENT LUCAS
utterance.content: Well you made it sound urgent.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It is urgent. One of my detectives and her colleague are missing.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: I’m not sure how I can help you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You can tell me where to find Mickey Dolan.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: I can’t discuss the Dolan case.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That is not acceptable. My people are out there and I don’t even know if they’re dead or alive. Now where is he?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: We have no idea where he is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That man just killed your informant, you realize that, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Father McMurtry was not our informant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dolan is your informant?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Not yet. But we knew he and McMurtry were friends. McMurtry was trying to get Dolan to turn state’s evidence against the O’Reilly family in exchange for immunity. We just brought Dolan in to discuss terms.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you have him in protective custody.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: He was. And today, when he found out Father McMurtry had been shot, he lost it. Dolan slipped out on the two agents that were guarding him and he escaped the safe house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute, if he was in federal custody the night of the murder then –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: - then he didn’t kill Father McMurtry.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So who did? Who had motive?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The O’Reillys. It was Dolan’s testimony that would send them all up the river.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: That’s why they’re all leaving town, that’s why they killed McMurtry. To draw him out.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So Dolan is hunting whoever killed the priest. And the O’Reillys are hunting Dolan.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: And both sides will take out anyone who gets in their way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get the gun. Get the gun!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing, Leo?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: My job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Let’s just say I’m an independent contractor trying to get close to his mark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re not a witness. You’re just pretending. You killed McMurtry because you were trying to get to Dolan and you knew that if you played the witness he would come to you.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Quick study.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why the charades? Why didn’t you just kill Castle and me?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Well it’s a little hard to play the innocent witness with two bodies lying around so I had to go along with the whole ‘on the run’ thing. But now time has run out and I have to make my next move. You. Where’s your phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, you don’t want to do this. Killing a cop, you know what kind of trouble that brings.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Kill her? Trust me, I’m not planning to kill her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well McMurtry trusted you. Look what happened to him

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: You think I killed Joey? Joey was my best friend. Long after our lives went off in separate directions. He never gave up on me. I’d never hurt him. I can’t say the same for whoever iced him. That’s why I need to talk to the witness before you put him in protective custody. So I can find out who the hell the son of b*itch was that took Joey out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do I know I can trust you?

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: You don’t. But you don’t have to. All you have to do is sit here and wait for my phone to ring. And when I get what I want we all walk away alive. Whether you believe me or not.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Here. Take the phone.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: You get ‘em?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry, Mickey. Maybe you should have sent more guys.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Maybe. I underestimated you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I wouldn’t make that same mistake again. Especially if you hurt Castle.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: So how about we make a trade? I’ll give you your writer back, you bring me the witness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No. I’m not agreeing to anything until I know that Castle is okay.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Shakespeare, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m fine. Listen, crazy as this sounds, I actually think that Mickey just wants to talk. Everything is going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hope so. Maybe then we can reschedule something with our parents. Maybe we can go and watch a baseball game. You know, something that all four of us can enjoy.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Good enough?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where should we meet?

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Under the Costello Bridge. It’s about 3 blocks from you in about 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Well played. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Not everything I told you was a lie. I really did have a shrink. But then he diagnosed me as a sociopath with homicidal tendencies, so I had to kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Leo. You don’t want to do this. Killing a cop is going to bring you a lot of grief from the NYPD, the FBI. Just let me go.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Sorry, can’t do that. I did find your relationship fascinating, though. Boy, you and Castle have some real issues. It’s a shame you won’t be able to work them out. But, like I said. Life is too short.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: There they are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! No!

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: What the –

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Looks like you missed.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: Drop the act. We both know you emptied your clip into that car.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: How did you get on to me?

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: I wish I could say I figured it out, but Shakespeare over here made the call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Once you made that comment about my mom enjoying baseball - I knew we were six months away from joking about that – I knew something had to be up.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: All I wanted to do was ask you a question about who killed my friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mickey.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: But I guess I don’t have to ask that anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mickey, don’t.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: He killed Joey in cold blood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. But what would Joey want? You said he never gave up on you. If you pull that trigger, you’re giving up on him.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: This doesn’t end with me. The O’Reillys? They’ll just send somebody else. You’re a dead man.

utterance.speaker: DOLAN
utterance.content: You know what? I can live with that. Take his gun.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Put your hands up.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought I lost you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. Never, never, never.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here, get you out of this. Let me get this off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now let’s get the hell out of here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That sounds good to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, excuse me. Can you help us get a ride?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: We’re going to be tied up for a bit. Why don’t you guys just take a cab?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Eh … let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you spot me $20 bucks?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dolan’s back in federal custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So is he going to turn state?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. But he is offering to serve some time for his past crimes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like Father McMurtry got to him after all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about Leo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He confessed to killing McMurtry in front of a cop that he had taken hostage. He’s going away for a long time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, after all this time I still can’t believe that he was the bad guy.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle. So nice to have you two back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice to be back.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well as worried as we were, I don’t think we were nearly as concerned as your folks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our folks?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah … I called them when we were trying to find you guys. You’re mom’s, uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – Say no more.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You can pick them up at the break room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I guess we can’t avoid dealing with them forever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No But you know what? Who cares if they don’t get along? They aren’t us. And so what if we don’t make sense on paper? We don’t live our lives on paper. And if we did we’d never be astounded or – – surprised.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So – so, anyway, he says “don’t touch me” – and then he said “yes”.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does that even happen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But let’s just – let’s just go with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
